GeneDef.label: abysmal humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Due to some weird genetic manipulation of the carrier's brain, they find themselves almost incapable of dealing any notable damage to humanlike targets.

GeneDef.label: extremely bad humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have significant difficulty killing other humanoids, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of fellow humanoids, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: very bad humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have major issues when trying to kill other humanoids, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of fellow humanoids, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: bad humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have issues when trying to kill other humanoids, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of fellow humanoids, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: somewhat good humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know some of the weak points of any humanlike enemy they fight, making it easier to slay their enemies.

GeneDef.label: good humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know a lot of the weak points of any humanlike enemy they fight, making it easier to slay their enemies.

GeneDef.label: very good humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know most of the weak points of any humanlike enemy they fight, making it easier to slay their enemies.

GeneDef.label: extremely good humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know every weak point of any humanlike enemy they fight, making it significantly easier to slay their enemies.

GeneDef.label: unbelievably good humanoid slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know every weak point of any humanlike enemy they fight and have the ability to predict where the humanoid will move next with a low accuracy rate, making it significantly easier to slay their enemies.\n\nAlite's note: Predictive ability doesn't really exist or do anything, it's just some fluff text that I use to be able to claim this gene makes complete sense.
